attributes.action: Stop police from passing animal abuse cases to RSPCA for a private prosecution.
attributes.background: This petition is set up to stop UK police forces from passing potential animal abuse cases to the RSPCA for a private prosecution. We strongly believe that if somebody has abused or caused unnecessary suffering to an animal, which is a criminal offence under the animal welfare act 2006,
attributes.additional_details: The police should deal with the case. Such as they do with any other breach of the law. The case should not be passed over to a private charity and become a private case in the eyes of the law.  In recent years there have been many cases were members of the public have had wrongful attempted prosecutions brought upon them. For example, Bob Skinner & Mr Pig in 2015. We believe it is in the best interest of the animals and the public that cases of animal abuse are dealt with by the police from start to finish. Once the case has passed into private hands, what is right and wrong becomes subjective and the lines of the law become blurred, and opinions start to overrule the facts.

attributes.action: Stop Sodexo from closing Katie's Kitchen
attributes.background: Katie's kitchen is a food van that his been running for over 20 years and now is being shut down by the greed of Sodexo. Katie's kitchen has given joy to surviving soldiers for many many years by coming out on exercise and saving the troops from the rotting stomach of ration packs
attributes.additional_details: Sodexo food is over priced and under quality. They will double the price of Katie's kitchen and they don't want any competition

attributes.action: Official EU Referendum RESULT of LEAVE announced 24TH JUNE 2016 must be CARRIED.
attributes.background: We the undersigned call upon HM Government to ENFORCE THE WILL OF THE PEOPLE as decided in the free and democratic EU REFERENDUM VOTE ON 23RD JUNE 2016 and as stated by Prime Minister David Cameron that the Brexit vote was the "will of the British people" and an "instruction which must be delivered"
attributes.additional_details:
Prime Minister demonstrated his FULL ACCEPTANCE of the result of the EU Referendum on 23rd June 2016, stating that the will of the British people on THAT vote was an instruction that MUST be delivered. This followed his resignation to the Queen, and later to his Government and The Country. 

This EU Referendum gained more votes in total than any General Election in UK history, the LEAVE RESULT also gained more votes than any political party taking office post a General Election. RESULT TO STAND.

attributes.action: Establish a Tort of Malicious Misrepresentation
attributes.background: In several recent elections politicians and news media have promoted misleading and inaccurate information to the general public on matters of public interest, denying them the right to make an informed decision on these matters, or have an informed opinion on matters of public interest in general.
attributes.additional_details: We believe that a Tort of Malicious Misrepresentation would enable these individuals, bodies and organisations to be held accountable by a non governmental body such as a Jury with damages going to repair the damage through promotion of the accurate and true position.

attributes.action: No longer allow letting agents to discriminate against 'dss'
attributes.background: I am disabled due to a stroke and receive housing Benefits to top up the wage I earn.  Letting agents are allowed to discriminate against this, regardless of circumstance. It harks back to the time when people were allowed to discriminate against skin colour and nationality.
attributes.additional_details: Where your funds come from should make no difference, housing benefit can be more reliable than wages in that you can't be fired! I have rented receiving benefits as a single person, a single mother, part of a couple and now as a disabled parent. I have always been discriminated against. Let's make this change and not victimise the most vulnerable of our society. Let's not be those people.

attributes.action: Implement the 10 recommendations of the APPG Inquiry Into Quality of New Homes.
attributes.background: The poor quality of new homes is not new. (NHBC, Barker Review of 2004, Office of Fair Trading Market Study of Home Building in the UK October 2008, and more recently the APPG Inquiry 2016) Yet surprisingly, there has not been any legislation to force this industry to improve.
attributes.additional_details:
Around 93% of new home buyers (at least 100,000 a year) report problems to their housebuilder. Defects that could and should have been prevented. The APPG Report is quite clear, the industry needs to be forced to improve both the quality of new homes and the indifferent service suffered by those buying new homes.

As a minimum, the government must implement the APPG Inquiry's “Key Recommendation” - the setting up of a New Homes Ombudsman by the DCLG within 3 months.

attributes.action: Take the rail franchise away from Southern Rail and give it to the government!
attributes.background: Southern Rail has been giving worse and worse service for years and years! Trains are being delayed and cancelled too frequently and causing major disruption for commuters.  It is time for a new company to be given the franchise or better yet for the government to take control of the rail system.
attributes.additional_details:
There has been many cases for which people have been affected by Southern Rail!

Southern Rail could not get me back home to from London to Eastbourne one night for being short staffed. I had to travel to Brighton and then get a bus to Seaford where everything had then terminated. As a result one of my relatives had to pick me up in the middle of the night. This journey had taken me over 3 hours!

Other people I know have found their trains cancelled or delayed in 4 out of 5 journeys in a week!

attributes.action: Educate all health professionals and teachers on Autism!!
attributes.background: Autism is a condition that not many people are aware of unless they have experience of it, as a result people with this condition are becoming more socially excluded in everyday life. People with the condition face constant battles and are misunderstood and judged due to the lack of education.

attributes.action: Introduce legislation to protect officers tackling motorbike & auto crime
attributes.background: Police officers have high levels of training in pursuit driving & tactical resolutions yet are afraid to use tactics i.e. Stop stick on motorbikes. There is no protection in law if something goes wrong and an offender is hurt. Motorbikes fail to stop regularly, commit crime & police can't pursue.
attributes.additional_details: Many crimes are carried out on motorcycles, robberies, shootings & drug dealing. Police wont pursue in case the criminals hurt themselves & officers are scared to use stop stick in case the criminal gets injured & they get blamed. Recent incidents in Merseyside have seen up to 60 motorbikes causing mayhem at one time, many on stolen bikes, riding on pavements, through red lights etc. Legislation is needed to protect officers so they can tackle this problem effectively & put blame on offenders.

attributes.action: Launch an Independent Inquiry into Hunt's Junior Doctor contract & 7day NHS plan
attributes.background: The Health Secretary has misrepresented data to claim a non-existent weekend mortality effect. The Public Accounts committee says his 7-day NHS plan is unfunded. His proposed contract has alienated a generation of doctors. We demand an Independent Inquiry into Hunt's actions and their consequences.
attributes.additional_details:
Public Accounts Committee report: http://www.parliament.uk/business/committees/committees-a-z/commons-select/public-accounts-committee/news-parliament-2015/nhs-staff-numbers-report-published-15-16/

Studies demonstrate Hunt's purported weekend effect - the basis for imposing his Junior Doctor contract - does not exist: http://www.theguardian.com/society/2016/may/06/fewer-die-in-hospital-weekends-study-jeremy-hunt-doctors-contract

attributes.action: Ban fire works restrict sales to 48 hours prior to bonfire night
attributes.background:
Ban the sale of fire works until 48 hours prior to an event, create a new law to controll fireworks the current noise and curfews do nothong 
Animal cruelty should should be a number one concern
attributes.additional_details: Just Google the effect on animals it's all there

attributes.action: Reform the IR35 Tax Regulations introduced in 2000.
attributes.background: The IR35 Regulations, introduced in 2000 to address the differences in liabilities due to HMRC between an employee and a self-employed freelance contractor providing services under a limited company, is a highly subjective, unclear and disproportionate piece of legislation that should be amended.
attributes.additional_details:
Specific reforms sought are:

Absolute clarity for a contractor of his/her IR35 status prior to a contract being signed so that appropriate rates can be negotiated.

Within IR35 status calculations:

Have sufficient allowances for expenses, particularly for travelling freelance contractors (rather than just 5% currently).

Exempt ENICs from the IR35 calculations, as regular employees do not pay ENICs.

Build sufficient allowances into the calculations to recognise a lack of employee benefits.

attributes.action: Make the BBC declare an interest when broadcasting on the EU referendum.
attributes.background: When directors of companies or MP's are involved in decision making where they have any financial or commercial interest, they are duty bound to declare that interest. The BBC coverage of the EU referendum  can be seen as biased as they receive a grant from the EU.
attributes.additional_details: BBC has received £2m in EU funding in run up to referendum, fuelling accusations of bias. (source Daily Telegraph)

attributes.action: Create a Ministerial position for the Self Employed
attributes.background:
There are almost 4.8 million self employed people in the UK who have no direct representation in Government.  Whilst there is a Minister for Small Business (which is applauded), the needs of the self employed, in many cases, are very different to even small employers.
This needs to be addressed
attributes.additional_details:
Areas that need addressing include (but are not limited to):

- The need for a 'self employed bank account' - A simple transactional account
- Affordable financial services - Realistically priced income protection and medical cover should be introduced.
- The levelling of the playing field in terms of maternity and paternity
- Increased Pension provision - employees are being encouraged to enrolled into a Workplace Pension.  What is the sole trader equivalent?   

What else can you add?

attributes.action: Allow citizens to raise concerns about behaviour of MPs during Commons' Debates
attributes.background: MPs may raise Points of Order during House of Commons’ debates if they think that an MP has said something offensive or inappropriate. There is no way for members of the public to do this. Members of the public should be able to raise matters of concern with the Speaker, for reporting to the House.
attributes.additional_details: For instance, it was customary for the Speaker to report to the House the conviction of a member by a criminal court even if the sentence did not disqualify them from remaining a member of the House (an example being Mr. Saklatvala in 1926).

attributes.action: Review the work of the Lowcost Holidays travel company bankruptcy scandal
attributes.background: Lowcost Holidays has gone into administration owing thousands of pounds to over 110,000 UK customers also without a holiday many of which were booked months in advance. Lowcost Holidays used to be ATOL and ABTA protected but moved to Majorca at the end of 2013.
attributes.additional_details: The practice of travel companies not paying for hotel accommodation/flights/transfers after they've been paid by customers should be made illegal. It's a company based within the EU but there is little or no EU protection for its citizens against this poor practice or when a travel company goes into administration. Why?

attributes.action: The UK must ratify the Paris Agreement on climate change immediately
attributes.background: At COP21 in December of 2015 real progress was made in creating global agreement for a low carbon future. For these agreements to be legally binding 55 countries representing 55% of global emissions must ratify the Paris Agreement. The US and China have just ratified- the UK must follow suit.
attributes.additional_details:
The UK represents 1,55% of global emissions, so its signature would make a tangible difference
http://unfccc.int/paris_agreement/items/9444.php

http://climateanalytics.org/hot-topics/ratification-tracker.html

We stand a real chance for progress now China and the US have signed (the worlds two biggest emitters by far).
http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-asia-china-37265541

attributes.action: Make Bullying illegal in the UK
attributes.background: Children are being permanently damaged but the affect of bullying it is morally wrong we as the people should be more vigilant in protecting our youth from the pain and forever damage bullying causes bullying needs to be illegal in all of its area from the simple name calling to the abuse
attributes.additional_details:
a on going debate on whether it should be illegal http://www.debate.org/opinions/should-bullying-be-illegal

http://www.teenink.com/opinion/school_college/article/331577/Should-There-Be-a-Law-Against-Bullying/

attributes.action: Change the prejudiced welfare system - Keep families together!
attributes.background: The welfare system does not grant enough rights to families to care for grandchildren. It is too prejudiced.  They are far too eager to take babies away for adoption. We need reform in the current system please.
attributes.additional_details: I can provide references which a personal to me but also which I am absolutely positive that other families out there will be in the same position to provide.

attributes.action: Reverse the decision to send the brightest and best international students home
attributes.background: New Immigration Rules (HC877) require students to return home if they secure a work placement year or perform better than expected and are upgraded (e.g. BEng to MEng). This is penalising the brightest and best, it is unfair and damages the UK's reputation. This decision should be reversed.
attributes.additional_details:
On 08/04/2016, the UK Council for International Student Affairs received the following:
"A student who needs more time to complete a course can only apply for further leave to do this if they meet one of the exemptions set out in 120A(a).  A student who undertakes a work placement would be changing their course and would therefore need to apply from overseas if they wanted to extend their leave to complete their (new) course."
The explanatory memorandum to HC877 does not detail this consequence.

attributes.action: Ban the use of pike gags and lip grips in England.
attributes.background:
Pike gags are a spring device that is used to hold a fishes mouth open to allow for unhooking. They are ban in Scotland as they are a barbaric tool.

Lip grips are a mechanical device that hold fish by the bottom jaw bone with a clamp
attributes.additional_details: Both pike gags and lip grips cause permenant damage to the jaw bone of pike and other boney mouth species

attributes.action: Increase the number of Police Constables and Increase Police Constables Pay
attributes.background: The number of Police officers continue to drop every year down to 207,140 as of March 31st 2015. More and more harsh cuts effect the safety of everyone, leave Police forces stretched and workload too high for each officer. Pay for officers is also too low and only getting 1% is a slap in the face.
attributes.additional_details: Government reports show the downward spiral in numbers. An offer of just 1% pay rise is just not acceptable, for the hard work, long hours and low pay that our officers have to put in. Especially in a modern environment filled with danger, our officers put their lives on the line, every day that they report for duty. They are not permitted to industrial strike action and have little in the way of representation. The people of the U.K. Now need to show our officers that we support them.

attributes.action: I do not believe we really need or want to have drones delivering parcels
attributes.background: Amazon and the government are about to conduct trials using drones to deliver parcels to their customers. Where Amazon go others will follow. Should we sacrifice the peace and quiet of the air for the benefit of a few and the profit of big corporations. Lets leave the sky above for the birds.
attributes.additional_details:
http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/video_and_audio/headlines/36887326
The talk is all about safety and not whether the public want or need such a service.

attributes.action: To get the NHS to give cancer patients full body screening yearly
attributes.background: I would like the NHS change the way the NHS screen for cancer. I have lost Family members to cancer including my Dad. I myself am living with cancer and it scares me to death for myself and my 7 year old daughter who needs me here to be her mum. I want full screening every year for cancer patients.
attributes.additional_details: In my experience cancer does come back  and quite often in a different area. This is why I feel it is important for all past and present cancer patients to receive a full body screening every year. I had a ovarian tumour removed in 2012 now in 2016 I have bowel cancer, I did receive yearly bloods targeted in pelvic area and the bowel cancer wasn't found. I feel by having full body screening yearly could save more lives, and less invasive treatment.

attributes.action: Stop HS2 destroying our villages in Barnburgh and Harlington. No to HS2
attributes.background: HS2 wants to run a high speed train through Mexborough, destroying homes, & Barnburgh and Harlington, destroying countryside. If it gets the go-ahead 18 trains per hour - running 5am until midnight - will pass through our town/villages. Sign this petition to say NO to HS2 destroying our area.

attributes.action: change the law for sentences that reflect in loss of life to a family dog.
attributes.background: Our family dog was recently run over by a speeding motorbike. Our dog was on a lead and this only happened because the rider of the bike was speeding. The law classes dogs as a possession so the rider of the bike can not be sentenced for killing our dog.
attributes.additional_details:
Our dog was part of the family as i'm sure most dogs are. If someone runs a dog over and they are at fault then I believe they should be senented for killing the dog, what if next time it's a child? 
The law classes dog's as property like a T.V. if your T.V breaks you relace it, you can't just replace a dog with another as they become part of the family.

attributes.action: A second referendum to consider the issue of Brexit before Article 50 is invoked
attributes.background: The UK Referendum of 24 June 2016 has profound social, economic and political implications. The results reveal the margin is less than 2% and more than 16 million people of voting age want to remain. The 18-50 age group is overwhelmingly remain.
attributes.additional_details:
Polling information shows the age group 18-50 (those that have to live with this result the longest) is overwhelmingly pro-remain (68%). Their democratic will should not be ignored.

More than 1 million Brits were excluded from the vote for having lived outside the UK for more than 15 years. Had they been eligible to vote, this is very likely to have returned a different result. 

It is appropriate in these circumstances for the UK Parliament to consider convening a second, more open referendum.

attributes.action: Ban the practice of 'crossing the floor' by an elected member of parliament.
attributes.background: The practice of 'crossing the floor' in Parliament is dishonest and is a betrayal of the constituents who voted for a particular MP. If an MP wishes to either join a different party or form a new one he should announce his intention and immediately resign his seat in order to stand in a by-election.

attributes.action: Prevent police action on free speech issues by better defining terms in UK Law.
attributes.background:
A man has been arrested in Scotland for posting a joke in bad taste. 
We recognise that free speech is one of the most important rights we have, and ask parliament to better define a specific piece of legislation to protect it.
attributes.additional_details:
All speech should be protected to ensure a healthy, open and accepting society, Intent behind statements must be considered. 
http://www.legislation.gov.uk/ukpga/2003/21/section/127
This piece of legislation should be rewrote to allow any speech to be permitted without fear of police involvement except in cases of incitements of violence, harrassment or targeted bullying, threats etc. Jokes, bad taste or not should never be illegal in a free society and the very idea of such is repugnant.

attributes.action: Bring back the death sentence for child murderers and peadophiles
attributes.background: We all want a better future for a children , a safer future . Punishments for predatory child killers and child abusers are nowhere near harsh enough . We as a people should give these predators through a democratic process something to fear to help keep our children and their future children safe .

attributes.action: Reduce the rate of Value Added Tax in the UK from the current 20% to 15%.
attributes.background: The cost of living for the majority of UK citizens is punitive. The lowest band of income tax rate at 20% is unaffordable for many. The tax free bands are too low. Families are homeless and hungry. If companies are to get tax breaks, citizens should too. Reduction in VAT will stimulate the economy.

attributes.action: To keep the Four Freedoms as defined by membership of the EEA even after Brexit.
attributes.background: All those who voted Remain and many who voted Leave are in favour of the Four Freedoms and accept that this includes Free Movement of People. These voters are the true majority. Restricting European migration was NOT an option on the ballot paper and should not, therefore, be a Brexit "deal breaker"
attributes.additional_details: For example, many small businesses voted Leave in protest of excessive EU regulations. Many more individuals voted Leave because they believed it would help fund the NHS. Plenty voted Leave to give the UK sovereignty over its own Laws. Others voted in protest of the Tory policy of austerity. Only a MINORITY of the voters voted Leave to control migration. The Government should, therefore, keep the Four Freedoms in the Brexit negotiations as is the wish of the voting majority.

attributes.action: 1.An MP's home residence address needs to be located in their own constituency?
attributes.background: The electorate only vote in the constituency where they live this rule is not a requirement to become an MP meaning if you wished to be an MP you could stand for any constituency in the UK the rules that apply to the constituencies voters should apply to anyone who stand as the MP.

attributes.action: Secure the UK's membership of the European Single Market as soon as possible.
attributes.background: Following the result of the referendum on the UK's membership of the EU this petition calls on the new government to do everything within its means to secure the UK's membership of the Single Market as soon as possible. This will save jobs, economic growth and indirectly funding for public services.
attributes.additional_details: Recent turmoil in the financial markets and the precipitous decline in the value of sterling have demonstrated the importance of economic certainty and the UK's membership of the Single Market. The EU is the UK's most important trading partner. Securing tariff-free access to imports and exports of goods and services is critical to UK economic growth, jobs and public services.

attributes.action: Make sports playing fields dog free areas - we need to protect our children.
attributes.background: I am a grassroots football coach and am becoming increasingly angered by the amount of time spent picking up dog faeces before training and matches. Talking to coaches from around the country this is a national problem. TIME TO BAN DOGS FROM ALL PLAYING FIELDS for the sake of our children.
attributes.additional_details:
My club in the East End of Newcastle have pushed hard to protect the kids, however the irresponsible dog owners appear at times that the wardens aren't around.
We have been highlighted in the Newcastle Evening Chronicle and some people have been fined but the practice of being ignorant by some people just doesn't stop.

attributes.action: No new trade deals with China until they stop forced organ harvesting
attributes.background: Doctors Against Forced Organ Harvesting (DAFOH) have estimated between 100,000 and 200,000 Falun Gong practitioners have been subjected to forced organ harvesting since 2000.
attributes.additional_details: Constant persecution, torture and imprisonment of religious followers is contrary to the values of the right to human life that we hold dear in the United Kingdom. We implore you to insist that any trade deals between the CCP and the UK are conditional on an end to forced organ harvesting and any form of oppression towards religious followers.

attributes.action: Stop The TV licence by Privatising the BBC.
attributes.background:
Stop the TV licence as it's immoral and not wanted by the majority of the public, is a biased organisation and it should not be compulsory to have a TV licence.
Taxing citizens to subsidise a biased broadcasting corporation is unfair and it shouldn't be allowed to happen!
attributes.additional_details:
In the digital age we live in, the BBC should be able to survive on advertisements and selling the rights to its various TV programs and even to charge a subscription if they wish to. ITV and Channels 4 and 5 survive without any contribution from a TV license Why Should the BBC be any different. 
It is time to stop charging this unfair tax which is punitive to those on lower incomes and not supported by the majority of the public.

attributes.action: maternity to be paid for at least 1 year on a % of 85-95
attributes.background: If a minimum sallary is £1200 a month it is impossible to survive with £500 a month in maternity period. The private rent is so expensive not to mention utilities and food, the maternity should be paid for 1 year like other countries and with a % of 85-95 of the sallary.

attributes.action: Allow Parliament a vote on planned Hinkley Point C/Bradwell nuclear power plants
attributes.background: The decision to accept the investment  from EDF and China to design, build and operate the first new ( as yet untested) nuclear power stations in a generation must be made only with the consent of parliament.
attributes.additional_details: Just a retired engineer who I believe represents the mass of public opinion

attributes.action: Stop Making Tax Digital because it will be hugley burdensome on small businesses
attributes.background: HMRC is pushing ahead with Making Tax Digital: a scheme that will force all business to maintain digital accounts. Currently most small businesses use paper accounting records or spreadsheets. Small businesses lack the skills, time and funding to maintain digital accounts.
attributes.additional_details: Contrary to what HMRC have said, small businesses will not benefit from MTD. Making Tax Digital is a misnomer because businesses have been filing digital tax returns for 20 years. HMRC would gain from MTD because HMRC would receive more detailed trading information for businesses. Whilst HMRC needs to ensure it collects the correct tax, HMRC completely under estimates the cost of compliance on small businesses.

attributes.action: Cyclists to display identification such as a number plate for accountability
attributes.background:
I believe because cyclists have anonymity some  ignore the Highway Code, creating a danger to themselves, other road users and pedestrians
I have witnessed numerous dangerous, reckless and ignorant actions
Identification and accountability could make the roads a safer place.
attributes.additional_details:
To reduce the risk cyclists present to themselves and others. Through accountability  to create a culture of best practice.
In an age of speed cameras and dashboard cams to make the cyclist identifiable when involved or causing incidents.
To promote greater harmony between the motorist and cyclist. To make the roads a safer place for pedestrians.

attributes.action: Make coloured (unnatural) hair and all piercings allowed in all schools
attributes.background: In most schools, unnatural hair colours and more than one piercing in each ear is not allowed because it's 'distracting'. However, its not. Students already cannot express themselves through clothing (uniform), so things like hair and piercings are the only thing left, and even that is not allowed.
attributes.additional_details: It is unfair that students cannot have coloured hair and more than one piercing in each ear. In almost all cases, they get in trouble and/or suspended because it's distracting. Yet, what is more distracting? Having coloured hair and a few ear piercings? Or getting suspended from school and not receiving an education? Hair and piercings are a form of expression and creativity. School should be a place where students can freely express their personality, not forced to become someone else.

attributes.action: Dementia carers give them the recognition and specialist  title they deserve.
attributes.background: It is a requirement for all staff working within dementia to have specialised training and qualifications so I feel they should be recognised for their hard work, passion and dedication in providing high standard of care for people suffering with dementia by making it a specialised career choice
attributes.additional_details: Being a manager of a dementia care home I hear a lot of staff and others refer to the carers as ONLY A CARER I feel this is degrading and demoralising. Their are a lot of good passionate caring carers out there that are not being recognised for this only recognition is bad recognition.Dementia is becoming more progressive and affecting the younger people as well as the elderly. More and more people may be affected by this condition due to people living longer, better awareness and research

attributes.action: The taxpayer should pay for the defence of our servicemen and women in court.
attributes.background: As government employees, members of the UK's Armed Forces who fought in Iraq, Afghanistan or elsehwere whilst serving the Crown, should not have to pay for their defence in court.
attributes.additional_details: If Mr Blair's defence is going to be borne by the taxpayer then so should our servicemen and women who have fought and served on the Crown and Governments behalf.

attributes.action: Introduce an Unemployability Benefit for people unemployed for 5 years or more.
attributes.background: We, the undersigned, want the UK Government to introduce an Unemployability Benefit, equivalent to the National Living Wage for a 35 hour week, for people unemployed for 5 years or more.
attributes.additional_details:
The majority of employers now refuse to employ people who have been out of work for any length of time. This is leaving more and more unemployed people out of work for longer periods.

The proposed Benefit would be funded by introducing a levy of 50% of UK Profits on companies who move their operations - in whole or in part - outside the UK.

attributes.action: Reintroduce the dredging of rivers to reduce flooding risk...
attributes.background: The EU directive effectively stopped rivers being dredged causing flash flooding because of the reduced capacity of rivers and their inability to contain run off. Now we are no longer at the behest of the EU we can reintroduce this effective means of flood control...

attributes.background: The Cancer Act 1939 prohibits advertisement of treatments & cures for cancer due to the large amount of false medicines being sold in the 1930's. attributes.action: A Call to Action:  Raising Awareness of Mental Ill-health in Higher Education
attributes.background:
The government and higher education authorities must recognise and prioritise the 'student voice' in promoting mental ill-health in higher education. Josephine NwaAmaka Bardi

Please copy and paste the link below to read more.  

https://imhblog.wordpress.com/
attributes.additional_details:
There is no health without mental health (Department of Health, 2011) just as there may be no academic achievement without mental health.

Please sign the petition in support of this extremely important issue.

It is hoped that our collective signatures will prompt the government to recognise and debate the importance of actively promoting the awareness of mental ill-health in higher education.

Josephine NwaAmaka Bardi
Mental Health Nurse
PhD Student

attributes.action: A confirmatory referendum on the UK's membership of the EU should be held.
attributes.background:
1. There was a margin of 3.8% in favour of leaving the EU.  This is within the margin of error.
2. As the first referendum is advisory, Parliament is entitled to ask the electorate to confirm its decision.  It is more democratic rather than less to ask for a confirmatory referendum.

attributes.action: Petition for the Re-Introduction of Tax Relief for All Pensions Schemes
attributes.background: In Order to help make pensions once more affordable and sustainable, re introduce tax relief on all pensions.
